links.title: Mark Cuban on Elon Musk and Tesla: "You're Investing in an Entrepreneur"
links.description: Well the long knives were certainly out for Tesla ( TSLA) and its CEO, Elon Musk this week. Wall Street, legal firms, the SEC, and media talking heads were all roused to action (or comment) over Musk's proposal to take the company private at $420 per share.

the Hacking of $AAPL is burried in few articles. Hush it = $$$. the hacker used VPN to sneak into company's data $SPY https://www.digitaltrends.com/computing/australian-student-hacked-apple-for-a-year-steals-90gb/

links.title: Australian student hacks into Apple, steals 90GB of data because he's a 'fan'
links.description: A 16-year-old private school student in Melbourne, Australia broke into Apple's network multiple times for an entire year to download 90GB of "secure" data and access customer accounts. He did this because he was a "fan" and even admitted to the police that working for Apple was his "dream job."

messages.body: $AAPL "apple serves supposedly not hackable" lol https://bgr.com/2018/08/16/apple-servers-hacked-teen-sensitive-data-year/

links.title: A 16-year-old hacked Apple and stole 90GB of secure files
links.description: Apple's servers are widely believed to be unhackable, and to date the company hasn't suffered any massive breach that would have exposed user data to hackers. Well, it turns out that while most hackers might not be able to get into Apple's servers, a sixteen-year-old Australian with a passion for Apple managed to do it, stealing some 90GB of secure files and accessing customer accounts in the process.

links.title: Thursday Apple Rumors: 16-Year-Old Hacks Apple, Steals Files
links.description: Leading the Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL ) rumor mill today is news of a young hacker stealing files from AAPL. Today, we'll look at that and other Apple Rumors for Thursday. Source: Shutterstock Hacker: A 16-year-old hacker was able to get past Apple's security and steal secure files from it, reports BGR.

messages.body: $aapl tax avoidance https://www.zerohedge.com/news/2018-08-15/tax-avoidance-apple-claims-hq-buildings-worth-only-200-save-taxes

links.title: Tax Avoidance: Apple Claims HQ Buildings Worth Only $200 To Save On Taxes
links.description: Silicon Valley's largest and most iconic companies are employing armies of lawyers to show that their buildings are worth a lot less than what county tax assessors state. In Santa Clara County, California, Apple Inc., the United States' first trillion-dollar company by market capitalization, had 489 open cases dating back to 2004, disputing nearly $8.5 billion in property value, according to the San Francisco Chronicle.
